title: Social Structure Formation and Sustained Mathematics Learning Strategies in Online Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of fundamental mathematical concepts (functions, statistics, geometry, etc.) and experience using online collaboration tools
context.additional_context: Conducting math problem-solving projects using web-based collaboration tools and social media technologies in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can design communication strategies with group members using online collaboration tools (Padlet, Google Jamboard, etc.)
Learners can improve by correcting errors in mathematical problem-solving processes at least three times through social media-based feedback systems
Learners can diagnose their own learning outcomes with over 80% accuracy through peer assessment in web-based learning communities
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
